channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 8 Buckley Road, NW6 7NE, 25th September
item.description:
Household / kitchen waste in thin bags has been dumped outside 8 Buckley Road, NW6 7NE. The house is not occupied (it is rented as a guesthouse) so noone is taking responsibility for this waste. We have a rat / fox / pest problem in the area and this waste is a health hazard.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Buckley Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household rubbish dumped on the street, 25th September
item.description:
There is also a large bag of clothes scattered over the pavement on the opposite side of the road. There are items dumped here every single day.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lampard Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blind spot for vehicle turning into Hornsey Road from Holloway Road, 25th September
item.description:
Have been witnessing near misses on a daily basis. I helped a cyclists who was hit by a right turning car once. There is usually slow moving/stationary traffic southbound on Holloway Road at this junction and the right turning vehicles from northbound Holloway Road into Hornsey Rd do not see cyclists/mopeds who use the bus lane and free to move on. I reported the problem to TfL last May, but they chose to ignore or downplay it. Someone will be hurt badly one day.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hornsey Street, Holloway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to car, 25th September
item.description:
Our motability vehicle was parked in a dedicated disabled bay. Multiple lime bikes were left outside the bike bay blocking a garage entrance and presumably fell on our car and have damaged the car. The bay is often full and so bikes are frequently parked outside the correct bay.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 111, Canfield Gardens, South Hampstead, London

item.title: Car been there for over a week causing heavy traffic on Colyers Lane every morning, 25th September
item.description:
What looks to be an abandoned car reg CJ21WJN has been there over a week parked awkwardly and causing heavy traffic but also alot of issues for larger vehicles and also turning into and out of Myrtle Close. This needs to be moved ASAP - It is parked right infront of 247 Colyers lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colyers Lane, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Work on the pavement is obstructing passage, 25th September
item.description:
There's been work on the pavement for at least a week, with digging and barriers. But this makes passage difficult and people in wheelchairs or with a buggy can't pass at all and reach the crossing because there's a step too high to pass.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton High Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
